On Oct 5, 2007, at 5:46 PM, Derek James wrote:

> It's
> the particular method of subdividing the population as a way of doing
> it that I'm questioning.

I wonder if, when creating NEAT, Ken tried using demes?  Where, each  
deme has four neighbors, and migration (random or best) happens  
occasionally between neighboring demes.  Edge demes wrap around (as  
in a toroid).  This makes sense to me in a tribal sort of way.

However, speciating on genome similarity also makes sense to me, but  
in a species sort of way.
--
Stephen Waits
steve@...
http://swaits.com/



--Apple-Mail-4-773094050
